client_certificate.description: Base64 encoded certificate to use to authenticate to the service principal.

client_certificate_password.description: Password for a client certificate password.

client_certificate_path.description: Path to a certificate to use to authenticate to the service principal.

client_id.description: The service principal client or managed service principal id which should be used.

client_id_apply.description: The service principal client id which should be used during an apply operation in Terraform Cloud.

client_id_plan.description: The service principal client id which should be used during a plan operation in Terraform Cloud.

client_secret.description: Client secret for authenticating to  a service principal.

client_secret_path.description: Path to a file containing a client secret for authenticating to  a service principal.

oidc_audience.description: Set the audience when requesting OIDC tokens.

oidc_request_token.description: The bearer token for the request to the OIDC provider. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_request_url.description: The URL for the OIDC provider from which to request an ID token. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_tfc_tag.description: Terraform Cloud dynamic credential provider tag.

oidc_token.description: OIDC token to authenticate as a service principal.

oidc_token_file_path.description: OIDC token from file to authenticate as a service principal.

org_service_url.description: The url of the Azure DevOps instance which should be used.

personal_access_token.description: The personal access token which should be used.

tenant_id.description: The service principal tenant id which should be used.

tenant_id_apply.description: The service principal tenant id which should be used during an apply operation in Terraform Cloud..

tenant_id_plan.description: The service principal tenant id which should be used during a plan operation in Terraform Cloud.

use_msi.description: Use an Azure Managed Service Identity.

use_oidc.description: Use an OIDC token to authenticate to a service principal.

commit_message.description: The commit message when creating or updating the file

overwrite_on_create.description: Enable overwriting existing files, defaults to "false"

enforce_job_scope.description: Limit job authorization scope to current project for non-release pipelines

enforce_referenced_repo_scoped_token.description: Protect access to repositories in YAML pipelines

enforce_settable_var.description: Limit variables that can be set at queue time

authorized.description: indicates whether the resource is authorized for use

access_key_id.description: The AWS access key ID for signing programmatic requests.

external_id.description: A unique identifier that is used by third parties when assuming roles in their customers' accounts, aka cross-account role access.

role_session_name.description: Optional identifier for the assumed role session.

role_to_assume.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume.

secret_access_key.description: The AWS secret access key for signing programmatic requests.

session_token.description: The AWS session token for signing programmatic requests.

azurecr_name.description: The AzureContainerRegistry registry which should be used.

azurecr_spn_tenantid.description: The service principal tenant id which should be used.

azurecr_subscription_id.description: The Azure subscription Id which should be used.

azurecr_subscription_name.description: The Azure subscription name which should be used.

personal_access_token.description: The Azure DevOps personal access token.

azurerm_management_group_id.description: The Azure managementGroup Id which should be used.

azurerm_management_group_name.description: The Azure managementGroup name which should be used.

azurerm_spn_tenantid.description: The service principal tenant id which should be used.

azurerm_subscription_id.description: The Azure subscription Id which should be used.

azurerm_subscription_name.description: The Azure subscription name which should be used.

service_endpoint_authentication_scheme.description: The AzureRM Service Endpoint Authentication Scheme, this can be 'WorkloadIdentityFederation', 'ManagedServiceIdentity' or 'ServicePrincipal'.

workload_identity_federation_issuer.description: The issuer of the workload identity federation service principal.

workload_identity_federation_subject.description: The subject of the workload identity federation service principal.

serviceprincipalid.description: The service principal id which should be used.

serviceprincipalkey.description: The service principal secret which should be used.

validate.description: Whether or not to validate connection with azure after create or update operations

password.description: The bitbucket password which should be used.

username.description: The bitbucket username which should be used.

docker_email.description: The DockerRegistry email address which should be used.

docker_password.description: The DockerRegistry password which should be used.

docker_registry.description: The DockerRegistry registry which should be used.

docker_username.description: The DockerRegistry username which should be used.

connection_url.description: URL of the Azure DevOps organization or the TFS Project Collection to connect to.

personal_access_token.description: Personal access tokens are applicable only for connections targeting Azure DevOps organization or TFS 2017 (and higher)

client_email.description: The client email field in the JSON key file for creating the JSON Web Token.

private_key.description: Private Key for connecting to the endpoint.

token_uri.description: The token uri field in the JSON key file for creating the JSON Web Token.

password.description: The password or token key to use for the generic service connection.

server_url.description: The server URL of the generic service connection.

username.description: The username to use for the generic service connection.

enable_pipelines_access.description: A value indicating whether or not to attempt accessing this git server from Azure Pipelines.

password.description: The password or token key to use for the GenericGit git service connection.

repository_url.description: The server URL of the GenericGit git service connection.

username.description: The username to use for the GenericGit service git connection.

personal_access_token.description: The GitHub personal access token which should be used.
The GitHub personal access token which should be used.

http_header.description: Optional http header name on which checksum will be sent.

secret.description: Optional secret for the webhook. WebHook service will use this secret to calculate the payload checksum.

accept_untrusted_certs.description: Allows the Jenkins clients to accept self-signed SSL server certificates without installing them into the TFS service role and/or Build Agent computers.

url.description: Url for the JFrog Artifactory Server
Url for the JFrog Artifactory Server
Url for the JFrog Artifactory Server
Url for the JFrog Artifactory Server

accept_untrusted_certs.description: Enable this if your authentication uses untrusted certificates

kube_config.description: Content of the kubeconfig file. The configuration information in your kubeconfig file allows Kubernetes clients to talk to your Kubernetes API servers. This file is used by kubectl and all supported Kubernetes clients.

repository_id.description: This is the ID of the server that matches the id element of the repository/mirror that Maven tries to connect to

access_token.description: The access token for npm registry

personal_access_token.description: The Azure DevOps personal access token which should be used.

cluster_endpoint.description: Client connection endpoint for the cluster. Prefix the value with 'tcp://';. This value overrides the publish profile.

password.description: Password for the Azure Active Directory account.

server_certificate_common_name.description: The common name(s) of the cluster's certificate(s). This is used to verify the identity of the cluster. This value overrides the publish profile. Separate multiple common names with a comma (',')

server_certificate_thumbprint.description: The thumbprint(s) of the cluster's certificate(s). This is used to verify the identity of the cluster. This value overrides the publish profile. Separate multiple thumbprints with a comma (',')

username.description: Specify an Azure Active Directory account.

client_certificate.description: Base64 encoding of the cluster's client certificate file.

server_certificate_common_name.description: The common name(s) of the cluster's certificate(s). This is used to verify the identity of the cluster. This value overrides the publish profile. Separate multiple common names with a comma (',')

server_certificate_thumbprint.description: The thumbprint(s) of the cluster's certificate(s). This is used to verify the identity of the cluster. This value overrides the publish profile. Separate multiple thumbprints with a comma (',')

cluster_spn.description: Fully qualified domain SPN for gMSA account. This is applicable only if `unsecured` option is disabled.

unsecured.description: Skip using windows security for authentication.

token.description: Authentication Token generated through SonarCloud (go to My Account > Security > Generate Tokens)
Authentication Token generated through SonarQube (go to My Account > Security > Generate Tokens)

account_key.description: A valid account key from the queue's storage account

queue_name.description: The name of the queue that will store the events

ttl.description: event time-to-live - the duration a message can remain in the queue before it's automatically removed

visi_timeout.description: event visibility timout - how long a message is invisible to other consumers after it's been dequeued

pipeline_id.description: The pipeline ID to be monitored. If not specified, all pipelines in the project will trigger the event

run_result_filter.description: Which run result should generate an event. Only valid if published_event is `RunStateChanged`. If not specified, all results will trigger the event

run_state_filter.description: Which run state should generate an event. Only valid if published_event is `RunStateChanged`. If not specified, all states will trigger the event

pipeline_id.description: The pipeline ID to be monitored. If not specified, all pipelines in the project will trigger the event

stage_name.description: Which stage should generate an event. Only valid if published_event is `StageStateChanged`. If not specified, all stages will trigger the event

stage_result_filter.description: Which stage result should generate an event. Only valid if published_event is `StageStateChanged`. If not specified, all results will trigger the event

stage_state_filter.description: Which stage state should generate an event. Only valid if published_event is `StageStateChanged`. If not specified, all states will trigger the event
